intro: Consolida regalis subsp. divaricata, commonly known as the spreading sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and often slightly lobed. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its more spreading growth habit compared to the typical form of Consolida regalis.
